post_text: Many of our students, in grades K-2 attended and participated in a local performance put on by Tom Chapin. This event was free for SABIS International School, as all expenses were covered by a local non-profit, the Foundation for Arts, Culture, Education in the East Valley (FACE). We had approximately 155 students, 15 parent chaperons and 10 teachers/staff who accompanied the students to this performance at the Higley Center for the Arts. Mr. Chapin has a curriculum that has been developed entitled Building Bridges. It teaches kids from third grade and under how to be positive, know how to handle bullies and see the diversity in each of our communities. As such, The Sabis students spent months learning the songs that were performed, and sang along with Tom as he performed. The hard work of the teachers, parents and of course students enabled them to learn, sing in a theater that holds 1200 people and have a great time. After the performance everyone had sack lunches at a local city park so the day ended with a lot of fun!
